member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject
member.summary: Represents an object that participates in the dependency property system.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for DependencyObject derived classes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.ClearValue(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty)
member.summary: Clears the local value of a dependency property.
member.param: The DependencyProperty identifier of the property for which to clear the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.GetAnimationBaseValue(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty)
member.summary: Returns any base value established for a dependency property, which would apply in cases where an animation is not active.
member.param: The identifier for the desired dependency property.
member.returns: The returned base value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.GetValue(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty)
member.summary: Returns the current effective value of a dependency property from a DependencyObject.
member.param: The DependencyProperty identifier of the property for which to retrieve the value.
member.returns: Returns the current effective value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.ReadLocalValue(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty)
member.summary: Returns the local value of a dependency property, if a local value is set.
member.param: The DependencyProperty identifier of the property for which to retrieve the local value.
member.returns: Returns the local value, or returns the sentinel value UnsetValue if no local value is set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.RegisterPropertyChangedCallback(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedCallback)
member.summary: Registers a notification function for listening to changes to a specific DependencyProperty on this DependencyObject instance.
member.param: The dependency property identifier of the property to register for property-changed notification.
A callback based on the DependencyPropertyChangedCallback delegate, which the system invokes when the value of the specified property changes.
member.returns: A token that represents the callback, used to identify the callback in calls to UnregisterPropertyChangedCallback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.SetValue(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the local value of a dependency property on a DependencyObject.
member.param: The identifier of the dependency property to set.
The new local value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.UnregisterPropertyChangedCallback(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,System.Int64)
member.summary: Cancels a change notification that was previously registered by calling RegisterPropertyChangedCallback.
member.param: The dependency property identifier of the property to unregister for property-changed notification.
A token that represents the callback (returned by RegisterPropertyChangedCallback).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.Dispatcher
member.summary: Always returns null in a Windows App SDK app. Use DispatcherQueue instead.
member.returns: Always null in a Windows App SDK app. Use DispatcherQueue instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.DispatcherQueue
member.summary: Gets the DispatcherQueue that this object is associated with. The DispatcherQueue represents a facility that can access the DependencyObject on the UI thread even if the code is initiated by a non-UI thread.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Assertive
member.summary: The element sends interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Off
member.summary: The element does not send notifications if the content of the live region has changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Polite
member.summary: The element sends non-interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to not interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was abandoned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionCompleted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemAdded
member.summary: The current element container has had something added to it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemRemoved
member.summary: The current element has had something removed from inside it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.Other
member.summary: The current element has a notification not an add, remove, completed, or aborted action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing
member.summary: Specifies the order in which to process a notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.All
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.CurrentThenMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Dont interrupt the current notification for this one. If new notifications come in from the same source while the current notification is being presented, then keep the most recent and ignore the rest until the current processing is completed. Then use the most recent message as the current message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantAll
member.summary:
These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.
> [!WARNING] > Use this in a limited capacity as this style of message could cause a flooding for information to the end user due to the nature of the request to deliver all of the notifications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. The most recent notifications from this source should be delivered to the user because the most recent notification supersedes all of the other notifications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.MostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Interrupt the current notification for this one.

Implement IScrollProvider in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a AutomationPeer.GetPattern call and PatternInterface.Scroll.

The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. Pass NoScroll if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

The target range for comparison.
The Start or End endpoint of the target.

Returns zero if the caller's endpoint is at the same location as the target endpoint. Returns a positive value if the caller's endpoint occurs later in the text than the target endpoint.

The attribute value to search for. This value must match the type specified for the attribute.
true if the last occurring text range should be returned instead of the first; otherwise, false.

true to return the last occurring text range instead of the first; otherwise, false.
true to ignore case; otherwise, false.

member.param: An array of bounding rectangles for each full or partial line of text in a text range. An empty array for a degenerate range. An empty array for a text range that has screen coordinates placing it completely off-screen, scrolled out of view, or obscured by an overlapping window.

member.summary: Retrieves the plain text of the range.
member.param: The maximum length of the string to return. Use 1 to specify an unlimited length.
member.returns: The plain text of the text range, which might represent a portion of the full string truncated at the specified maxLength.

member.summary: Moves the text range the specified number of text units.

The number of text units to move. A positive value moves the text range forward; a negative value moves the text range backward; and a value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved. This value can be less than the count requested if either of the new text range endpoints is greater than or less than the DocumentRange endpoints. This value can be negative if navigation is happening in the backward direction.

member.summary: Moves one endpoint of a text range to the specified endpoint of a second text range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.

An endpoint on the other range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.MoveEndpointByUnit(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves one endpoint of the text range the specified number of text units within the document range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
The text measure unit for moving.

member.returns: The number of units actually moved, which can be less than the number requested if moving the endpoint runs into the beginning or end of the document.

member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that have an intrinsic value that does not span a range and that can be represented as a string. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a AutomationPeer.GetPattern call and PatternInterface.Value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.SetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of a control.
member.param: The value to set. The provider is responsible for converting the value to the appropriate data type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the value of a control is read-only.
member.returns: true if the value is read-only; false if it can be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the control.
member.returns: The value of the control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes a method to support the virtualized item control pattern. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a AutomationPeer.GetPattern call and PatternInterface.VirtualizedItem.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize
member.summary: Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that provide fundamental window-based functionality within a traditional graphical user interface (GUI). Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a AutomationPeer.GetPattern call and PatternInterface.Window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.Close
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.summary: Changes the visual state of the window (such as minimizing or maximizing it).
member.param: The visual state of the window to change to, as a value of the enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.WaitForInputIdle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling code for the specified time or until the associated process enters an idle state, whichever completes first.
member.param: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait for the associated process to become idle.
member.returns: true if the window has entered the idle state; false if the timeout occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.InteractionState

member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the window is the topmost element in the z-order of layout.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.Maximizable

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount
member.summary: Contains values that are used by the IScrollProvider pattern to indicate the direction and distance to scroll.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large decrements, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE UP key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE UP key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large increments, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE DOWN key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE DOWN key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.NoAmount
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling should not be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small decrements, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small increments, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum
member.summary: Defines constants that identify text attributes of a Microsoft UI Automation text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnimationStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnimationStyle text attribute, which specifies the type of animation applied to the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationAnimationStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationObjectsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnnotationObjects text attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationTypesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnnotationTypes text attribute, which maintains a list of annotation type identifiers for a range of text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AnnotationType enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BackgroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the BackgroundColor text attribute, which specifies the background color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BulletStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the BulletStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of bullets used in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationBulletStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CapStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CapStyle text attribute, which specifies the capitalization style for the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretBidiModeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CaretBidiMode text attribute, which indicates the direction of text flow in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationCaretBidiMode enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretPositionAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CaretPosition text attribute, which indicates whether the caret is at the beginning or the end of a line of text in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationCaretPosition enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CultureAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Culture text attribute, which specifies the locale of the text by locale identifier (LCID).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontName text attribute, which specifies the name of the font. Examples: "Arial Black"; "Arial Narrow". The font name string is not localized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontSizeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontSize text attribute, which specifies the point size of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontWeightAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontWeight text attribute, which specifies the relative stroke, thickness, or boldness of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.ForegroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the ForegroundColor text attribute, which specifies the foreground color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.HorizontalTextAlignmentAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the HorizontalTextAlignment text attribute, which specifies how the text is aligned horizontally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationFirstLineAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationFirstLine text attribute, which specifies how far, in points, to indent the first line of a paragraph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationLeading text attribute, which specifies the leading indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationTrailing text attribute, which specifies the trailing indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsActiveAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsActive text attribute, which indicates whether the control that contains the text range has the keyboard focus (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsHiddenAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsHidden text attribute, which indicates whether the text is hidden (true) or visible (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsItalicAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsItalic text attribute, which indicates whether the text is italic (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsReadOnlyAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsReadOnly text attribute, which indicates whether the text is read-only (true) or can be modified (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSubscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsSubscript text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSuperscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsSuperscript text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.LinkAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Link text attribute, which contains the ITextRangeProvider interface of the text range that is the target of an internal link in a document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginBottomAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginBottom text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the bottom margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginLeading text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the leading margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTopAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginTop text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the top margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginTrailing text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the trailing margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OutlineStylesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OutlineStyles text attribute, which specifies the outline style of the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationOutlineStyles enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OverlineColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the overline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OverlineStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the overline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.SelectionActiveEndAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the SelectionActiveEnd text attribute, which indicates the location of the caret relative to a text range that represents the currently selected text. This attribute is specified as a value from the AutomationActiveEnd enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StrikethroughColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the strikethrough text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StrikethroughStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the strikethrough text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleIdAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StyleId text attribute, which indicates the text styles in use for a text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationStyleId enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StyleName text attribute, which identifies the localized name of the text style in use for a text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TabsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Tabs text attribute, which is an array specifying the tab stops for the text range. Each array element specifies a distance, in points, from the leading margin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TextFlowDirectionsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the TextFlowDirections text attribute, which specifies the direction of text flow. This attribute is specified as a combination of values of the AutomationFlowDirections enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the UnderlineColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the underline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the UnderlineStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the underline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

The event data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions
member.summary: Represents the options that can be applied when an element is brought into view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BringIntoViewOptions class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use animation when the element is brought into view.
member.returns: true to use animation; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the left vertical edge and 1.0f representing the right vertical edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the area of an element to bring into view.
member.returns: A rectangle that defines the area of an element to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the top horizontal edge and 1.0f representing the bottom horizontal edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains state information and event data associated with a routed event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEventArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RoutedEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEventArgs.OriginalSource
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that raised the event. This is often a template part of a control rather than an element that was declared in your app UI.
member.returns: The object that raised the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the scrolling should be animated.
member.returns: true to animate the scrolling; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the requested horizontal alignment ratio which controls the alignment of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport.
member.returns: The requested horizontal alignment ratio between 0.0 and 1.0, or NaN. See Remarks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the element that should be made visible in response to the event.
member.returns: The element that should be made visible in response to the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the Rect in the TargetElements coordinate space to bring into view.
member.returns: The Rect in the TargetElements coordinate space to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the requested vertical alignment ratio which controls the alignment of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport.
member.returns: The requested vertical alignment ratio between 0.0 and 1.0, or NaN. See Remarks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement
member.summary: UIElement is a base class for most of the Windows Runtime UI objects that have visual appearance and can process basic input as part of your app's user interface.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyDisplayDismissed
member.summary: Occurs when access keys should no longer be displayed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyDisplayRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user requests that access keys be displayed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyInvoked
member.summary: Occurs when a user completes an access key sequence.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested
member.summary: Occurs when StartBringIntoView is called on this element or one of its descendants.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CharacterReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a single, composed character is received by the input queue.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ContextCanceled
member.summary: Occurs when a context input gesture continues into a manipulation gesture, to notify the element that the context flyout should not be opened.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ContextRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user has completed a context input gesture, such as a right-click.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DoubleTapped
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled DoubleTap interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragEnter
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragLeave
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the origin.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragOver
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the potential drop target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragStarting
member.summary: Occurs when a drag operation is initiated.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Drop
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drop event with this element as the drop target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DropCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a drag-and-drop operation with this element as the source is ended.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a UIElement receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a UIElement receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Holding
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled Hold interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a UIElement loses focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a UIElement loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a manipulation on the UIElement is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationDelta
member.summary: Occurs when the input device changes position during a manipulation.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationInertiaStarting
member.summary: Occurs when the input device loses contact with the UIElement object during a manipulation and inertia begins.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationStarted
member.summary: Occurs when an input device begins a manipulation on the UIElement.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationStarting
member.summary: Occurs when the manipulation processor is first created.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.NoFocusCandidateFound
member.summary: Occurs when a user attempts to move focus (via tab or directional arrows), but focus doesn't move because no focus candidate is found in the direction of movement.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerCanceled
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer that made contact abnormally loses contact.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerCaptureLost
member.summary: Occurs when pointer capture previously held by this element moves to another element or elsewhere.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerEntered
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer enters the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerExited
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer leaves the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerMoved
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer moves while the pointer remains within the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerPressed
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer device initiates a Press action within this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerReleased
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer device that previously initiated a Press action is released, while within this element. Note that the end of a Press action is not guaranteed to fire a PointerReleased event; other events may fire instead. For more info, see Remarks.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerWheelChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the delta value of a pointer wheel changes.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PreviewKeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PreviewKeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ProcessKeyboardAccelerators
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard shortcut (or accelerator) is pressed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RightTapped
member.summary: Occurs when a right-tap input stimulus happens while the pointer is over the element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Tapped
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled Tap interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AddHandler(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element. Specify handledEventsToo as true to have the provided handler be invoked even if the event is handled elsewhere.
member.param: An identifier for the routed event to be handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.

true to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data.
false to register the handler with the default condition that it will not be invoked if the routed event is already marked handled. The default is false.
Do not routinely ask to rehandle a routed event, because it interferes with the intended design of the Windows Runtime event system for control compositing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Arrange(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Positions child objects and determines a size for a UIElement. Parent objects that implement custom layout for their child elements should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The final size that the parent computes for the child in layout, provided as a Rect value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CancelDirectManipulations
member.summary: Cancels ongoing direct manipulation processing (system-defined panning/zooming) on any ScrollViewer parent that contains the current UIElement.
member.returns: true if a ScrollViewer parent exists and setting the value resulted in canceling the panning/zooming action. false if calling the method results in no action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CapturePointer(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.Pointer)
member.summary: Sets pointer capture to a UIElement. Once captured, only the element that has capture will fire pointer-related events.
member.param: The pointer object reference.
member.returns: true if the object has pointer capture; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.FindSubElementsForTouchTargeting(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Enables a UIElement subclass to expose child elements that assist with resolving touch targeting.
member.param: The point being touched.
The bounds used for touch tolerance.
member.returns: A set of point sets. These represent the vertices of sub elements that are intersected by the given touch point (plus tolerance).

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Focus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusState)
member.summary: Attempts to set focus to this element.
member.param: How this element obtains focus.
member.returns: True if keyboard focus and logical focus were set to this element. False if only logical focus was set to this element, or if the call to this method did not force the focus to change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GetChildrenInTabFocusOrder
member.summary: Enables a UIElement subclass to expose child elements that take part in Tab focus.
member.returns: A collection of the UIElement's child elements that take part in Tab focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GetVisualInternal
member.summary: Retrieves the Visual that the element resolves to.
member.returns: The Visual that the element resolves to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for a UIElement. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which will occur asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for a UIElement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Measure(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Updates the DesiredSize of a UIElement. Typically, objects that implement custom layout for their layout children call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The available space that a parent can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.OnBringIntoViewRequested(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs)

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement
member.summary: Provides a base element class for Windows Runtime UI objects. FrameworkElement defines common API that support UI interaction and the automatic layout system. FrameworkElementalso defines API related to data binding, defining and examining the object tree, and tracking object lifetime.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualThemeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the ActualTheme property value has changed.

member.summary: Occurs when the FrameworkElement's effective viewport changes.

member.summary: Occurs when a FrameworkElement has been constructed and added to the object tree, and is ready for interaction.

member.summary: Returns the BindingExpression that represents the binding on the specified property.
member.param: The identifier for the target dependency property to get the binding from.
member.returns: A BindingExpression if the target property has an active binding on this object; otherwise, returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.GoToElementStateCore(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, enables per-state construction of a visual tree for a control template in code, rather than by loading XAML for all states at control startup.
member.param: The state to transition to.
true to use a VisualTransition to transition between states. false to skip using transitions and go directly to the requested state. The default is false.
member.returns: true if the control successfully transitions to the new state, or was already using that state; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.InvalidateViewport
member.summary: Invalidates the viewport state for a UIElement that is used to calculate the effective viewport.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MeasureOverride(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call ApplyTemplate. In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in your app. Override this method to influence the default post-template logic of a class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IconSource.CreateIconElementCore
member.summary: Creates an icon UI element.
member.returns: An instance of the IconElement subtype that the source is associated with. For example, FontIconSource.CreateIconElementCore() returns an instance of FontIcon with all of the FontIcon properties set to the corresponding properties on the source. This object is then kept track of by the base class so it can update the properties on that object when the properties on the source change.

member.summary: Starts playing the loaded animated visual, or does nothing if no animated visual is loaded.
member.param: The point from which to start the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.
The point at which to finish the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.
If true, the animation loops continuously between _fromProgress_ and _toProgress_. If false, the animation plays once then stops.
member.returns: An async action that is completed when the play is stopped or, if _looped_ is not set, when the play reaches _toProgress_.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CalendarView.IsGroupLabelVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the month name is shown with the first day of the month when the DisplayMode is Month, or whether the year name is shown with the first month of the year when the DisplayMode is Year.
member.returns:
true if the month name is shown with the first day of the month; otherwise, false. The default is false.
The formatting of the group label can be set with the FirstOfMonthLabel properties (for example FirstOfMonthLabelFontSize) and FirstOfMonthYearDecadeLabel properties (for example FirstOfYearDecadeLabelFontSize).

member.summary: Specifies that the Click event should be raised when the mouse button is pressed and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the Click event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and the control has keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Release
member.summary: Specifies that the Click event should be raised when the left mouse button is pressed and released, and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the Click event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and released, and the control has keyboard focus.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Selector should keep the SelectedItem synchronized with the current item in the Items property.
member.returns:
true if the SelectedItem is always synchronized with the current item in the ItemCollection; false if the SelectedItem is never synchronized with the current item; null if the SelectedItem is synchronized with the current item only if the Selector uses an ICollectionView. The default value is null/indeterminate.
If you are programming using C#or Microsoft Visual Basic, the type of this property is projected as **bool?**(a nullable Boolean.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.ArrangeInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the arrange state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.MeasureInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the measurement state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.Arrange(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Positions child elements and determines a size for a container UIElement. Container elements that support attached layouts should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final size that the container computes for the child in layout.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InitializeForContext(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which occurs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.Measure(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Suggests a DesiredSize for a container element. A container element that supports attached layouts should call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update. The attached layout is expected to call the Measure for each of the containers UIElement children.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

The available space that a container can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.SetIndexBasedLayoutOrientation(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation)
member.summary: Sets the value of the IndexBasedLayoutOrientation property.
member.param: A value of the enumeration that indicates the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.UninitializeForContext(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that indicates the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection. The default is None (see Remarks).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and supports virtualization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VirtualizingLayout class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.

member.summary: Causes the Frame to load content represented by the specified Page-derived data type, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation, and a value indicating the animated transition to use.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type.
The navigation parameter to pass to the target page; must have a basic type (string, char, numeric, or GUID to support parameter serialization using GetNavigationState.
Info about the animated transition.
member.returns: false if a NavigationFailed event handler has set Handled to true; otherwise, true. See Remarks for more info.

member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying information regarding a long-running and/or background task that has completed successfully. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the Processing_All constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBarSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying information regarding a condition that might cause a problem in the future. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the NotificationProcessing_ImportantAll constant.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the horizontal axis in a LinedFlowLayout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the line, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the line, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceEvenly
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the line, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space in a LinedFlowLayout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the ItemsJustification property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and and does not support virtualization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NonVirtualizingLayout class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.UninitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext
member.summary: Represents the base class for layout context types that do not support virtualization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NonVirtualizingLayoutContext class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext.Children
member.summary: Gets the collection of child UIElements from the container that provides the context.
member.returns: The collection of child elements from the container that provides the context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext.ChildrenCore
member.summary: Implements the behavior for getting the return value of Children in a derived or custom NonVirtualizingLayoutContext.
member.returns: The value that should be returned as Children by the NonVirtualizingLayoutContext.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Compact
member.summary:
The spin buttons have two visual states, depending on focus. By default, the spin buttons are displayed in a compact, vertical orientation. When the Numberbox gets focus, the spin buttons expand.
:::image type="content" source="./microsoft.ui.xaml.controls/images/controls/numberbox-spinbuttonplacementmode-compact.png" alt-text="NumberBox showing both visual states for Compact spin buttons":::

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Hidden
member.summary: The spin buttons are not displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Inline
member.summary:
The spin buttons are displayed in an expanded, horizontal orientation.
:::image type="content" source="./microsoft.ui.xaml.controls/images/controls/numberbox-spinbuttonplacementmode-inline.png" alt-text="NumberBox with Inline spin buttons":::

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPager.MaxVisiblePips
member.summary: The maximum number of pips shown in the PipsPager at one time.
member.returns:
The maximum number of pips shown in the PipsPager at one time. The default value is 5.
When possible, the PipsPager always centers itself on the selected pip.
MaxVisiblePips should be set to a positive number. If set to 0, no pages will be visible to the user.

member.summary: The navigation button is visible and enabled, but hidden when content is at one or the other extent. For example, the Previous button is hidden when the current page is the first page, and the Next button is hidden when the current page is the last page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPagerButtonVisibility.VisibleOnPointerOver
member.summary: The button behavior is the same as Visible except the button is visible only when the pointer cursor is over the pager, or keyboard focus is inside the pager or on a navigation button.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Auto
member.summary: The show mode is determined automatically based on the method used to show the flyout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Standard
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown reactively, like a context menu. The open flyout takes focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's expanded state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Transient
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown proactively. The open flyout does not take focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's collapsed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.TransientWithDismissOnPointerMoveAway
member.summary: The flyout exhibits Transient behavior while the cursor is close to it, but is dismissed when the cursor moves away.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.JumpListItemBackgroundConverter
member.summary: Provides the appropriate background Brush for elements in the item template of a jump list to bind to. The Brush reflects the current theme and accent color, and it's also used to shade empty-group jump list items. By default, the Brush matches built-in apps, but you can override that to suit your design needs using the Enabled and Disabled properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the preferred location for positioning a ToolTip relative to a visual element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is below the target element when element receives keyboard focus, at the bottom of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Left
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is to the left of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the left of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Mouse
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is with the top-left corner of the tooltip positioned at the mouse pointer location when hovered over with mouse, above the target element when focused with keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Right
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is to the right of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the right of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Top
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is above the target element when element receives keyboard focus, at the top of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the type of Scroll event that occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.EndScroll
member.summary: The Thumb was dragged to a new position and is now no longer being dragged by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.First
member.summary: The Thumb moved to the Minimum position of the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeIncrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the right for a horizontal ScrollBar or downward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.Last
member.summary: The Thumb moved to the Maximum position of the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallDecrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of SmallChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallIncrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of SmallChange. The Thumb moved to the right for a horizontal ScrollBar or downward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbPosition
member.summary: The Thumb moved to a new position because the user selected Scroll Here in the shortcut menu of the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbTrack
member.summary: The Thumb was dragged and caused a PointerMoved event. A Scroll event of this ScrollEventType may occur more than one time when the Thumb is dragged in the ScrollBar.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the visibility of a scrollbar within a ScrollViewer control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary:
A ScrollBar appears only when the viewport cannot display all of the content.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the ScrollViewer parent. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Disabled
member.summary:
A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is disabled.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the ScrollViewer parent. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary:
A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is still enabled, and can occur through touch, keyboard, or mouse wheel interaction.
The dimension of the content is not affected by the dimension of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary:
A ScrollBar always appears.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the ScrollViewer parent. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the ScrollViewer to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor, and optionally disables scrolling animation.
member.param: A value between 0 and ScrollableWidth that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and ScrollableHeight that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.
A value between MinZoomFactor and MaxZoomFactor that specifies the required target ZoomFactor.
true to disable zoom/pan animations while changing the view; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.returns: true if the view is changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single})
member.summary: Causes the ScrollViewer to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor.
member.param: A value between 0 and ScrollableWidth that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and ScrollableHeight that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.
A value between MinZoomFactor and MaxZoomFactor that specifies the required target ZoomFactor.
member.returns: true if the view is changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ZoomToFactor(System.Single)
member.summary:
> [!NOTE] > ZoomToFactor may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows8.1. Instead, use ChangeView.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom
member.summary: Represents a scrollable control that incorporates two views that have a semantic relationship. For example, the ZoomedOutView might be an index of titles, and the ZoomedInView might include details and summaries for each of the title entries. Views can be changed using zoom or other interactions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how panning snap points are processed for gesture/manipulation input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Mandatory
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.MandatorySingle
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to the release point along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.None
member.summary: No snapping behavior. Only the manipulation influences the final location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Optional
member.summary: Content stops at a snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia, depending on how close the snap point is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.OptionalSingle
member.summary: Content stops at the next snap point, if the motion starts far from it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how the pane is shown in a SplitView.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactInline
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the CompactPaneLength property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane pushes the content to the side when it's open and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactOverlay
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the CompactPaneLength property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The pane is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Overlay
member.summary: The pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.returns: true to cancel the pane closing action; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The pane is shown to the left of the SplitView content .

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewPanePlacement.Right
member.summary: The pane is shown to the right of the SplitView content .

member.summary: Defines constants that specify the direction that content is scaled.

member.summary: The content stretches to fit the parent according to the Stretch property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.StretchDirection.DownOnly
member.summary: The content scales downward only when it is larger than the parent. If the content is smaller, no scaling upward is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.StretchDirection.UpOnly
member.summary: The content scales upward only when it is smaller than the parent. If the content is larger, no scaling downward is performed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainBackgroundPanel
member.summary:
Implements a XAML layout surface target for Microsoft DirectX interoperation scenarios. This panel has some atypical restrictions on its usage within an app window; see Remarks.
> [!IMPORTANT] > SwapChainBackgroundPanel may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows8.1 Instead, use SwapChainPanel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainBackgroundPanel.#ctor
member.summary:
> [!NOTE] > SwapChainBackgroundPanel may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows8.1 Instead, use SwapChainPanel.
Initializes a new instance of the SwapChainBackgroundPanel class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel
member.summary: Provides a hosting surface, where Microsoft DirectX swap chains provide content that can be rendered into a XAML UI. A SwapChainPanel element is a key component for an app that renders Microsoft DirectX graphics and then presents those visuals within a XAML page.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the composition scale factor of the SwapChainPanel has changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SwapChainPanel class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CreateCoreIndependentInputSource(Microsoft.UI.Input.InputPointerSourceDeviceKinds)
member.summary: Creates a core input object that handles the input types as specified by the deviceKinds parameter. This core input object can process input events on a background thread.
member.param: A combined value of the enumeration.
member.returns: An object that represents the input subsystem for interop purposes and which can be used for input event connection points.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleX
member.summary: Gets the x-axis scale factor of the SwapChainPanel.
member.returns: The x-axis scale factor of the SwapChainPanel. A value of 1.0 means no scaling is applied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleXProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CompositionScaleX dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CompositionScaleX dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleY
member.summary: Gets the y-axis scale factor of the SwapChainPanel.
member.returns: The y-axis scale factor of the SwapChainPanel. A value of 1.0 means no scaling is applied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleYProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CompositionScaleY dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CompositionScaleY dependency property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwipeBehaviorOnInvoked.Auto
member.summary: In Reveal mode, the SwipeControl closes after an item is invoked. In Execute mode, the SwipeControl remains open.

member.summary: The SwipeControl closes after an item is invoked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwipeBehaviorOnInvoked.RemainOpen
member.summary: The SwipeControl remains open after an item is invoked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabView
member.summary:
The TabView control is a way to display a set of tabs and their respective content. Tab controls are useful for displaying several pages (or documents) of content while giving a user the capability to rearrange, open, or close new tabs.
**Is this the right control?**
Use a TabView to help the user manage multiple app pages or documents within the same window.
Do not use a TabView to display a static set of tabs that the user cannot rearrange, open, or close. Use a NavigationView (NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode of Top) instead.
