member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that describe the behavior of the close button contained within each TabViewItem.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.Always
member.summary: The selected tab always shows the close button if it is closable. Unselected tabs always show the close button if they are closable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.Auto
member.summary:
Behavior is defined by the framework. Default.
This value maps to Always.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.OnPointerOver
member.summary: The selected tab always shows the close button if it is closable. Unselected tabs show the close button when the tab is closable and the user has their pointer over the tab.

member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to highlight the selected text when the TextBox does not have focus.
member.returns: The brush used to highlight the selected text when TextBox loses focus. To disable the SelectionHighlightColorWhenNotFocused, set the brush to Transparent once again.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the non-scrolling or non-virtualizing axis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the row or column, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the row or column, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceEvenly
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the row or column, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space in a UniformGridLayout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the ItemsJustification property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Uniform
member.summary: The item is sized to both fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.summary: Explicitly triggers initialization of the control's CoreWebView2.
member.returns: A Task that represents the background initialization process. When the task completes then the CoreWebView2 property will be available for use (non-null). Note that the CoreWebView2Initialized event will be invoked before the task completes or on exceptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.EnsureCoreWebView2Async(Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2Environment,Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2ControllerOptions)
member.summary: Explicitly triggers initialization of the control's CoreWebView2 with the specified environment and controller options.
member.param: A pre-created CoreWebView2Environment that should be used to create the CoreWebView2. Creating your own environment gives you control over several options that affect how the CoreWebView2 is initialized. If you pass null then a default environment will be created and used automatically.

A pre-created CoreWebView2ControllerOptions that should be used to create the CoreWebView2. Creating your own controller options gives you control over several options that affect how the CoreWebView2 is initialized. If you pass a controllerOptions to this method then it will override any settings specified on the CreationProperties and no value has been set to CreationProperties then a default controllerOptions will be created and used automatically.
member.returns: An asynchronous action that represents the background initialization process. When it completes the CoreWebView2 property will be available for use (i.e., non-null).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingMode.OneTime
member.summary: Updates the target property when the binding is created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingMode.OneWay
member.summary: Updates the target property when the binding is created. Changes to the source object can also propagate to the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Updates either the target or the source object when either changes. When the binding is created, the target property is updated from the source.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingOperations
member.summary: Provides the static SetBinding method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingOperations.SetBinding(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingBase)
member.summary: Associates a Binding with a target property on a target object. This method is the code equivalent to using a {Binding} markup extension in XAML markup.
member.param: The object that should be the target of the evaluated binding.

The property on the target to bind, specified by its identifier. These identifiers are usually available as static read-only properties on the type that defines the target object, or one of its base types. You can also bind to attached properties, but see Remarks.
The binding to assign to the target property. This Binding should be initialized: important Binding properties such as Path should already be set before passing it as the parameter.

member.summary: Don't use this value of RelativeSourceMode; always use either Self or TemplatedParent.

member.summary: Refers to the element to which the template (in which the data-bound element exists) is applied. This is similar to setting a TemplateBinding Markup Extension and is only applicable if the Binding is within a template.

member.summary: The binding source is updated only when you call the BindingExpression.UpdateSource method. (Not supported for x:Bind.)

member.summary: The binding source is updated whenever the binding target element loses focus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.UpdateSourceTrigger.PropertyChanged

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the DataContextChanged event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that influences whether another DataContextChanged event should be fired from child elements that inherit the DataContext value and detect that the value has changed.
member.returns: true to prevent further DataContextChanged events from being fired for each child FrameworkElement that inherits the DataContext value. You would do this to indicate to other handlers that the necessary logic for responding to the data context change has already been performed. false to permit the event to be fired by each immediate child FrameworkElement in the element tree that detects a change to the inherited DataContext value. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: Gets the new DataContext value for the element where the DataContextChanged event fired.
member.returns: An object representing the new DataContext value for the element where the DataContextChanged event fired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty
member.summary: Represents a dependency property that is registered with the dependency property system. Dependency properties provide support for value expressions, data binding, animation, and property change notification. For more info on how DependencyProperty values serve as identifiers for dependency properties, see Dependency properties overview.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.GetMetadata(Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName)
member.summary: Retrieves the property metadata value for the dependency property as registered to a type. You specify the type you want info from as a type reference.
member.param: The name of the specific type from which to retrieve the dependency property metadata, as a type reference (System.Type.
member.returns: A property metadata object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.Register(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers a dependency property with the specified property name, property type, owner type, and property metadata for the property. Use this method when defining or initializing a DependencyObject derived class that will own the registered dependency property.
member.param: The name of the dependency property to register.
The type of the property, as a type reference (System.Type.
The owner type that is registering the dependency property, as a type reference (System.Type.

A property metadata instance. This can contain a default value and a PropertyChangedCallback implementation reference. Passing null for this parameter is equivalent to passing a new PropertyMetadata instance created by calling PropertyMetadata.Create with null as the default value parameter.
member.returns: A dependency property identifier that typically is stored in a publicstaticread-only field in your DependencyObject derived class. The identifier is then used both by your own code and any third-party user code to reference the dependency property later, for operations such as setting its value programmatically or attaching a Binding in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers an attached dependency property with the specified property name, property type, owner type, and property metadata for the property.
member.param: The name of the dependency property to register.
The type of the property, as a type reference (System.Type.
The owner type that is registering the dependency property, as a type reference (System.Type.
A property metadata instance. This can contain a PropertyChangedCallback implementation reference.
member.returns: A dependency property identifier that should be used to set the value of a publicstaticread-only field in your class. That identifier is then used to reference the attached property later, for operations such as setting its value programmatically or attaching a Binding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue
member.summary: Specifies a static value that is used by the property system rather than null to indicate that the property exists, but does not have its value set by the property system or by any app code.
member.returns: The sentinel value for an unset value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedCallback
member.summary: Represents the callback that is invoked when a property value changes, for property change notifications that are registered with the RegisterPropertyChangedCallback technique.
member.param: The object instance that holds the property to register for property-changed notification.
The dependency property identifier of the property to register for property-changed notification.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for a PropertyChangedCallback implementation that is invoked when a dependency property changes its value. Also provides event data for the Control.IsEnabledChanged event and any other event that uses the DependencyPropertyChangedEventHandler delegate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the dependency property after the reported change.
member.returns: The dependency property value after the change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.OldValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the dependency property before the reported change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.Property
member.summary: Gets the identifier for the dependency property where the value change occurred.
member.returns: The identifier field of the dependency property where the value change occurred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle events that occur when a DependencyProperty is changed on a particular DependencyObject implementation.
member.param: The source of the event (typically the object where the property changed).
The event data.

member.summary: Gets a value that specifies which operations (none, move, copy, and/or link) are allowed by the source of the drag event.

member.summary: Gets a read-only copy of the Data object.

member.summary: Represents the duration of time that a Timeline is active, or more generally represents a duration of time that also supports two special values Automatic and Forever.

member.summary: The TimeSpan value component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration.Type
member.summary: The type as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper
member.summary: Provides basic utility methods for processing Duration values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use methods of Duration instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Add(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Adds the TimeSpan component of two Duration values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the Addition method instead.
member.param: The value to add to.
The value to add.
member.returns: The resulting Duration after TimeSpan component addition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Compare(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Compares value equality of two Duration structures. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.Compare instead.
member.param: The first Duration to compare.
The second Duration to compare.
member.returns: If duration1 is less than duration2, a negative value that represents the difference. If duration1 is equal to duration2, zero. If duration1 is greater than duration2, a positive value that represents the difference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Equals(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Determines whether two Duration values have equivalent values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the Equality method instead.
member.param: The first Duration to compare.
The second Duration to compare.
member.returns: true if target and value hold equivalent values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.FromTimeSpan(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new Duration based on a TimeSpan constructor instead.
member.param: The initializing TimeSpan.
member.returns: The created Duration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.GetHasTimeSpan(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Returns whether the TimeSpan component of a given Duration holds a non-null value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.HasTimeSpan instead.
member.param: The Duration value to evaluate.
member.returns: true if the TimeSpan component of the provided Duration is not null; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Subtract(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Subtracts the TimeSpan component of one Duration value from another Duration value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the Subtraction method instead.
member.param: The value to subtract from.
The value to subtract.
member.returns: The resulting Duration after TimeSpan component subtraction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Automatic
member.summary: Returns a generated Duration value that indicates an "Automatic" Duration. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.Automatic instead.
member.returns: A Duration value that indicates an "Automatic" Duration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Forever
member.summary: Returns a generated Duration value that indicates a "Forever" Duration. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.Forever instead.
member.returns: A Duration value that indicates a "Forever" Duration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals
member.summary: Describes the capital letter style value for the Typography.Capitals attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllPetiteCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllSmallCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Normal
member.summary: Capital letters render normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.PetiteCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.SmallCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Titling
member.summary: Glyph forms are substituted with a typographic form specifically designed for titles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Unicase
member.summary: Capital letters display in unicase. Unicase fonts render both uppercase and lowercase letters in a mixture of uppercase and lowercase glyphs determined by the type designer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting font-specific versions of glyphs for a specified East Asian writing system or language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.HojoKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the Hojo Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis04
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS04 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis78
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS78 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis83
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS83 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis90
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS90 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.NlcKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the NLC Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Normal
member.summary: No font-specific glyph versions are applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Simplified
member.summary: Replaces traditional Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding simplified forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Traditional
member.summary: Replaces simplified Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding traditional forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.TraditionalNames
member.summary: Replaces simplified Kanji forms with their corresponding traditional forms. This glyph set is explicitly limited to the traditional forms considered proper for use in personal names.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting glyphs of different width styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Full
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with full width (usually em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Half
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with half width (half em) glyphs

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Normal
member.summary: Default width style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Proportional
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with proportionally spaced glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Quarter
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-quarter width (one-quarter em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Third
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-third width (one-third em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Normal
member.summary: Default style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Slashed
member.summary: Stacked fraction style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Stacked
member.summary: Slashed fraction style is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment
member.summary: Describes the numeral alignment value for the Typography.NumeralAlignment attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Normal
member.summary: Default numeral alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Proportional
member.summary: Proportional width alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Tabular
member.summary: Tabular alignment is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle
member.summary: Describes a numeral style value for the Typography.NumeralStyle attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Lining
member.summary: Lining numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with numeric forms of even height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Normal
member.summary: Default numeral style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.OldStyle
member.summary: Old style numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with a figure style that matches lowercase letters in height and color.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants
member.summary: Describes a font variant value for the Typography.Variants attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Inferior
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an inferior glyph, or it might combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Inferior forms are typically used in chemical formulas or mathematical notation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Normal
member.summary: Default font behavior. Font scaling and positioning is normal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ordinal
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an ordinal glyph, or it might combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Ordinal forms are normally associated with numeric notation of an ordinal word, such as "1st" for "first".

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ruby
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a smaller Japanese Kana glyph. This is used to clarify the meaning of Kanji, which might be unfamiliar to the reader.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Subscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a subscript glyph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Superscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a superscript glyph. Superscript is commonly used for footnotes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason
member.summary: Specifies values that represent reasons that a Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement got focus in a desktop application that uses a DesktopWindowXamlSource object to host XAML-based UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Down
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating down by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.First
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating to the next element by using bidirectional navigation, such as pressing Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Last
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating to the previous element by using bidirectional navigation, such as pressing Shift-Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Left
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating left by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Programmatic
member.summary: The focus was set programmatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Restore
member.summary: The focus was restored after a task switch, such as pressing Alt + Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Right
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating right by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Up
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating up by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest
member.summary: Provides information about a focus request for a DesktopWindowXamlSource object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Guid)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest class with the reason for the navigation request, the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus, and the unique correlation ID for the request.
Initializes a new instance of a XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest object for the the specified navigation request reason, the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus, and the unique correlation ID for the request.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

The bounding rectangle of the element in the desktop application that is losing focus (that is, the element that had focus before the DesktopWindowXamlSource received focus). This parameter is used to provide context to the WinUI XAML framework when the user enters the DesktopWindowXamlSource using a 4-direction navigation experience, such as the keyboard arrow keys.

The unique identifier for the navigation request. You can use this parameter for logging purposes, or if you have an existing correlation ID from an in-progress focus movement already in progress and you want to connect that focus movement with the current navigation request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest object for the the specified navigation request reason and the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

The bounding rectangle of the element in the desktop application that is losing focus (that is, the element that had focus before the DesktopWindowXamlSource received focus). This parameter is used to provide context to the WinUI XAML framework when the user enters the DesktopWindowXamlSource using a 4-direction navigation experience, such as the keyboard arrow keys.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest object for the the specified navigation request reason.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

member.returns: The unique ID generated when a focus movement event is initiated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager
member.summary: A helper class that enables global management of focus actions and events across all elements in an application.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before an element actually receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before focus moves from the current element with focus to the target element. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move again before bubbling is complete.

member.returns: The first focusable object.

member.summary: Retrieves the last element that can receive focus based on the specified scope.

member.returns: The last focusable object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction (cannot be used with tab navigation, see remarks).
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
The options to help identify the next element to receive focus with keyboard/controller/remote navigation.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction and hint rectangle.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.

A bounding rectangle used to influence which element is most likely to be considered the next to receive focus. Examples where this can be useful include:
- When no element currently has focus, specifying a small rectangle at a screen location of (-1, -1) starts focus from the upper left corner of the display. - In a program guide where you want to ensure programs at the current time receive focus. (The focus algorithm might favor shows at a later time based on a number of factors.)
member.returns: null if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the application UI.
member.returns: null if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.returns: The object that has focus. Typically, this is a Control class.

One of the values from the FocusState enumeration that specify how an element can obtain focus.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.Key

Gets the virtual-key associated with the event.

member.returns: A system value that indicates the code for the key referenced by the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.OriginalKey
member.summary:
Gets the original, unmapped virtual-key associated with the event.
Depending on the input device, the input button might be mapped to a different key value. For the mapped event value, see the Key property.
member.returns: A system value that indicates the code for the key referenced by the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator
member.summary:
Represents a keyboard shortcut (or accelerator) that lets a user perform an action using the keyboard instead of navigating the app UI (directly or through access keys).
Accelerators are typically assigned to buttons or menu items.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Invoked
member.summary: Occurs when the key combination for this KeyboardAccelerator is pressed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the KeyboardAccelerator class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a keyboard shortcut (accelerator) is available to the user.
member.returns: true if the shortcut is available; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabledProperty
member.summary: Identifies the IsEnabled dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the IsEnabled dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Key
member.summary:
Gets or sets the virtual-key (used in conjunction with one or more modifier keys) for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.KeyProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Key dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the Key dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Modifiers
member.summary:
Gets or sets the virtual-key used to modify another keypress for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ModifiersProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Modifiers dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the Modifiers dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the scope (or target) of the keyboard accelerator.
member.returns: The scope (or target) of the keyboard accelerator. The default is null (global scope).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ScopeOwnerProperty
member.summary: Identifies the ScopeOwner dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the ScopeOwner dependency property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes
member.summary: Specifies how a target UI element interprets manipulation events. This enumeration is flagwise, so you can set multiple modes for the ManipulationMode property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.All
member.summary: Enable all manipulation interaction modes except those supported through Direct Manipulation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.None
member.summary: Do not present graphic interaction with manipulation events.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.Rotate
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that rotate the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.RotateInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to rotate actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.Scale
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that scale the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.ScaleInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to scale actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.System
member.summary: Enable system-driven touch interactions supported through Direct Manipulation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to translate actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateRailsX
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the X axis but using a rails mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateRailsY
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the Y axis but using a rails mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateY
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the Y axis.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains the arguments returned by the last pointer event message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a PointerPoint object that provides basic info about the pointer associated with the event.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overallcoordinate system, use a relativeTo value ofnull.
member.returns: A PointerPoint value that represents the pointer point associated with this event. If null was passed as relativeTo, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a relativeTo value other than null was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetIntermediatePoints(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of PointerPoint objects that represent the pointer history from the last pointer event up to and including the current pointer event. Each PointerPoint in the collection provides basic info about the pointer associated with the event. The last item in the collection is equivalent to the PointerPoint object returned by GetCurrentPoint.
member.param: Provides the context for the pointer data. Can be any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. If null, location coordinates are in the context of the app.
member.returns: The collection of PointerPoint objects corresponding to the pointer history associated with the event. If relativeTo is null, location coordinates are in the context of the app. Otherwise, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled, and prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.IsGenerated
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pointer event occurred from direct interaction with an object by the user, or was generated by the platform based on changes to the UI of the application.
member.returns: true if the event was generated by the platform; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.KeyModifiers
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates which key modifiers were active at the time that the pointer event was initiated.
member.returns: A value or values of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.Pointer
member.summary: Gets a reference to a pointer token.
member.returns: A pointer token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs
member.summary: Provides event data for the ProcessKeyboardAccelerators event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the event as handled.
member.returns: true to mark the event handled. false to leave the event unhandled. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs.Key
member.summary:
Gets the virtual-key (used in conjunction with one or more modifier keys) for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs.Modifiers
member.summary:
Gets the virtual-key used to modify another keypress for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.summary: Returns the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overallcoordinate system, use a relativeTo value ofnull.
member.returns: A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If null was passed as relativeTo, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a relativeTo value other than null was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.returns: A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If null was passed as relativeTo, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a relativeTo value other than null was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.TappedRoutedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.TappedRoutedEventArgs.PointerDeviceType
member.summary: Gets the PointerDeviceType for the pointer device that initiated the associated input event.
member.returns: The PointerDeviceType for this event occurrence.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode
member.summary: Specifies the 2D directional navigation behavior when using the keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Auto
member.summary: Behavior is inherited from the elements ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback behavior is Disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Disabled
member.summary: Arrow keys cannot be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Enabled
member.summary: Arrow keys can be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy
member.summary:
Specifies the disambiguation strategy used for navigating between multiple candidate targets using XYFocusDownNavigationStrategy, XYFocusLeftNavigationStrategy, XYFocusRightNavigationStrategy, and XYFocusUpNavigationStrategy.
> [!NOTE] > Other factors, such as the previously focused element or proximity to the axis of the navigation direction, can influence the navigation end result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback strategy is Projection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction. The edge of the bounding rect corresponding to the navigation direction is extended and projected to identify candidate targets. The first element encountered is identified as the target. In the case of multiple candidates, the closest element is identified as the target. If there are still multiple candidates, the topmost/leftmost element is identified as the candidate. Focus moves from A to C and then from C to B on down navigation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation. Focus moves from A to D on down navigation based on projection of the bottom edge of A

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric). This distance is calculated by adding the primary distance and the secondary distance of each potential candidate. In the case of a tie: - The first element to the left is selected if the navigation direction is up or down - The first element to the top is selected if the navigation direction is left or right Here we show how focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance. - Distance (A, B, Down) = 10 + 0 = 10 - Distance (A, C, Down) = 0 + 30 = 30 - Distance (A, D, Down) 30 + 0 = 30 Focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride
member.summary:
Specifies how the XAML framework determines the target of an XY navigation.
Overrides XYFocusKeyboardNavigationStrategyMode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback strategy is Projection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction. The edge of the bounding rect corresponding to the navigation direction is extended and projected to identify candidate targets. The first element encountered is identified as the target. In the case of multiple candidates, the closest element is identified as the target. If there are still multiple candidates, the topmost/leftmost element is identified as the candidate. Focus moves from A to C and then from C to B on down navigation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.None
member.summary: No navigation override is applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation. > [!NOTE] > Other factors, such as the previously focused element and proximity to the axis of the navigation direction, can influence the result. Focus moves from A to D on down navigation based on projection of the bottom edge of A

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric). This distance is calculated by adding the primary distance and the secondary distance of each potential candidate. In the case of a tie: - The first element to the left is selected if the navigation direction is up or down - The first element to the top is selected if the navigation direction is left or right Here we show how focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance. - Distance (A, B, Down) = 10 + 0 = 10 - Distance (A, C, Down) = 0 + 30 = 30 - Distance (A, D, Down) 30 + 0 = 30 Focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel
member.summary: Defines constants that specify which level of layout cycle tracing events should trigger a debugger breakpoint when a layout cycle crash appears imminent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel.High
member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is triggered on more events than the Low setting, including all Measure and Arrange calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel.Low
member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is triggered only at the minimal level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel.None
member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is never triggered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel
member.summary: Defines constants that specify whether layout cycle tracing information is written to the native debugger and the level of detail that is recorded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.High
member.summary: More verbose layout cycle information is provided that includes all Measure and Arrange calls with their availableSize and finalSize values. The output is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. The same information is also output to the native debugger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.Low
member.summary: Minimal layout cycle information is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. The same information is also output to the native debugger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.None
member.summary: Minimal layout cycle information is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. There is no output to the native debugger.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter
member.summary: Produces a pre-parsed binary representation of a XAML production.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter.Write(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.IXamlMetadataProvider)
member.summary:
Produces a binary representation of XAML. Input streams are produced in text representation, and output streams are populated with XAML in binary (XBF) representation.
> [!IMPORTANT] > XamlBinaryWriter is not intended for use by typical app code. It is intended for use by tools and processes that are directly involved in producing an app package on a developer's machine.
member.param: The set of input streams. These are expected to access the text representation of the XAML to write into XBF format.
The set of output streams. When the method returns each output stream provides access to the XBF binary representation. You'd typically use this stream to create a file.
A helper object that maps types for XAML productions.
member.returns: A structure that captures any error information that is reported by the conversion into XBF format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation
member.summary: Records error information produced by calls to XamlBinaryWriter.Write.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.InputStreamIndex
member.summary: The index of the stream in the original inputStreams parameter for XamlBinaryWriter.Write where the error occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.LineNumber
member.summary: The line number in the input XAML text representation where the error was encountered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.LinePosition
member.summary: The line position in the input XAML text representation where the error was encountered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase
member.summary: Provides a base class used to create XAML brushes that paint an area with a CompositionBrush.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for XamlCompositionBrushBase derived classes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnConnected
member.summary:
Invoked when a brush is first used on screen to paint an element.
When implemented in a derived class, you can create a CompositionBrush instance and provide it to the framework by setting the CompositionBrush property.
OnDisconnected will be called when the brush is no longer being used to paint any elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnDisconnected
member.summary:
Invoked when the brush is no longer being used to paint any elements.
When implemented in a derived class, you can safely dispose of the compostion brush and other composition resources.
OnConnected will be called again if the brush is later used to paint any elements after being disconnected.

member.summary: Gets or sets the CompositionBrush used by this XAML brush.
member.returns: The instance of CompositionBrush used by this XAML brush.

member.summary: Identifies the FillBehavior dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the FillBehavior dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the repeating behavior of this timeline.
member.returns: An iteration Count that specifies the number of times the timeline should play, a TimeSpan value that specifies the total length of this timeline's active period, or the special value Forever, which specifies that the timeline should repeat indefinitely. The default value is a RepeatBehavior with a Count value of 1, which indicates that the timeline plays once.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the RepeatBehavior dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the RepeatBehavior dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate, relative to its parent, at which time progresses for this Timeline.
member.returns: A finite value greater than 0 that specifies the rate at which time progresses for this timeline, relative to the speed of the timeline's parent. If this timeline is a root timeline, specifies the default timeline speed. The value is expressed as a factor where 1 represents normal speed, 2 is double speed, 0.5 is half speed, and so on. The default value is 1.

member.summary: Gets the value of the Storyboard.TargetName XAML attached property from a target element.
member.param: The target element from which to get the value.
member.returns: The Storyboard.TargetName value of the target element.

member.summary: Gets the value of the Storyboard.TargetProperty XAML attached property from a target element.
member.param: The target element from which to get the value.
member.returns: The Storyboard.TargetProperty value of the target element.

member.summary: Pauses the animation clock associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the animation clock, or run-time state, associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Seek(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position. The storyboard performs the requested seek when the next clock tick occurs.
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SeekAlignedToLastTick(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position immediately (synchronously).
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.summary: Causes the specified Timeline to target the specified object.
member.param: The timeline that targets the specified dependency object.
The actual instance of the object to target.

member.summary: Sets the value of the Storyboard.TargetName XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element to set the value for.
The Storyboard.TargetName value of the target element to set. This should correspond to an existing Name or x:Name value on the UI element that the animation targets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTargetProperty(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the Storyboard.TargetProperty XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element for which to set the value.
The Storyboard.TargetProperty value of the target element to set. This specifies a qualification path that targets the dependency property where the animation applies. See Remarks.

member.summary: The coordinate system is not relative to a bounding box. Values are interpreted directly in local space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox
member.summary: The coordinate system is relative to a bounding box: 0 indicates 0percent of the bounding box, and 1 indicates 100percent of the bounding box. For example, (0.5, 0.5) describes a point in the middle of the bounding box, and (1, 1) describes a point at the lower right of the bounding box.

member.summary: Defines constants that specify how MediaTransportControls fast-forward/backward buttons behave.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Disable
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Hide
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are hidden.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Skip
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the media skips 30 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of PathFigure objects contained in a Geometry are combined to form the area of the Geometry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.summary: A rectangle that has a height equal to the line thickness and a length equal to half the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose base length is equal to the thickness of the line.

member.summary: Line joins use beveled vertices.

member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Round

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection
member.summary: Represents a perspective transform (a 3-D-like effect) on an object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PlaneProjection class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationXProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CenterOfRotationX dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CenterOfRotationX dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationYProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CenterOfRotationY dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CenterOfRotationY dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. The default is 0. Values greater than 0 correspond to coordinates in front of the plane of the object, and negative values correspond to coordinates behind the plane of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationZProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CenterOfRotationZ dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CenterOfRotationZ dependency property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.ThemeShadow
member.summary:
A ThemeShadow is a preconfigured shadow effect that can be applied to any XAML element to draw shadows appropriately based on x, y, z coordinates. ThemeShadow also automatically adjusts for other environmental specifications:
- Adapts to changes in lighting, user theme, app environment, and shell. - Shadows elements automatically based on their elevation. - Keeps elements in sync as they move and change elevation. - Keeps shadows consistent throughout and across applications.

member.summary: Provides utility methods that can be used to traverse object relationships (along child-object or parent-object axes) in the visual tree of your app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.DisconnectChildrenRecursive(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Explicitly removes all references from a target UIElement, with the goal of cleaning up reference cycles.
member.param: The target object to disconnect children and remove references from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of subtree if specified).

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified intersectingPoint coordinates, then the return value contains only the subtree object and any objects that have a higher z-order than subtree, listed by inverse of z-order. If the subtree object doesn't exist at intersectingPoint coordinates, the return value will be empty.
true to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. false to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is false.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of subtree if specified).

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified intersectingPoint coordinates, then the return value contains only the subtree object and any objects that have a higher z-order than subtree, listed by inverse of z-order. If the subtree object doesn't exist at intersectingPoint coordinates, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect.

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified intersectingRect, then the return value contains only the subtree object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the subtree object doesn't exist within the intersectingRect frame, the return value will be empty.
true to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. false to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is false.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect.

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified intersectingRect, then the return value contains only the subtree object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the subtree object doesn't exist within the intersectingRect frame, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.GetId
member.summary:
Returns the identifier for the custom XamlLight type.
In most cases you should use a unique identifier to prevent conflicts. For example, you can use the FullName of your custom XamlLight type.
The identifier is used to add and remove Brushes and UIElements as targets for a specific light type.
member.returns: The identifier for the XamlLight.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnConnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary:
This method is automatically called when the XamlLight is first in use on the screen, or after being previously disconnected then used again.
This provides an opportunity to create resources such as the CompositionLight only when required.
OnDisconnected will be called when the XamlLight is no longer being used to light any UIElements or Brushes.
member.param: The UIElement that the light is attached to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnDisconnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary:
This method is automatically called when the XamlLight is no longer in use anywhere on the screen.
This provides an opportunity to safely dispose of resources such as the CompositionLight when they aren't currently required.
OnConnected will be called again if the XamlLight is later used to light any UIElements or Brushes after being disconnected.
member.param: The UIElement that the light is attached to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.RemoveTargetBrush(System.String,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Brush)

member.summary: The page is cached and the cached instance is reused for every visit regardless of the cache size for the frame.

member.summary: Influences how a line box height is calculated

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Full
member.summary: Uses normal line box height calculation, this is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Tight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font, bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToBaseline
member.summary: Bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToCapHeight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder
member.summary: Provides a value for TextReadingOrder properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.Default
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use FlowDirection value (if any) for reading order decisions. (Do not use. See Remarks.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.DetectFromContent
member.summary: Detect flow direction from text content. For bidirectional text, text containers will infer the reading order for text based on the content. See Remarks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.UseFlowDirection
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use FlowDirection value (if any) for reading order decisions. (See Remarks.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming
member.summary: Describes how text is trimmed when it overflows the edge of its containing box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.CharacterEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a character boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.Clip
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a pixel level, visually clipping the excess glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.None
member.summary:
Default.
Text is truncated at a word boundary.
No trim indicator is drawn and the TextBlock IsTextTrimmedChanged event does not fire.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a word boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping
member.summary: Specifies whether text wraps when it reaches the edge of its container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: No line wrapping is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Line breaking occurs if a line of text overflows beyond the available width of its container. Line breaking occurs even if the text logic can't determine any line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will wrap at a point that might be in the middle of a word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.WrapWholeWords
member.summary: Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width. A line may overflow beyond the block width if the text logic can't determine a line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will overflow the long word and continue the text after the long word on the next line. Not supported by all controls; see Remarks.

The name of the state to transition to.

The representation of the state to transition to.
true to use a VisualTransition to transition between states; otherwise, false.

Always returns null in a Windows App SDK app.
> [!NOTE] > Window.Dispatcher may be altered or unavailable in future releases. Use Window.DispatcherQueue instead.
